section.name: 4. EJB Facade
section.p: Demonstrates deploying Cayenne on JBoss server and accessing it via a SessionBean facade. Example project structure is based on JBoss project template.
section.panel: This is a very simple example that demonstrates how to fetch and update data via EJB facade to Cayenne. It omits a few things like bridging Cayenne DataObjects and Data Transfer Objects (DTO), etc.

When opening cayenne.xml from this example in CayenneModeler, you will see that "Container-Managed Transactions" checkbox is checked for the "Auctions" DataDomain. This setting is important to prevent Cayenne from attempting explicit commit/rollback when container-managed transactions are in effect.

subsection.name: 4.1 Preparing the Environment
subsection.p: The example requires running JBoss server, version 3.0 or newer. Building the example requires Ant and XDoclet 1.1.2.

subsection.name: 44.2 Building Example
subsection.p: After installing XDoclet and starting JBoss, follow generic instructions for building examples. Build script will deploy all application components to the JBoss server.

subsection.name: 4.3 Running Example
subsection.p: Web client can be accessed on the JBoss server via a URL like http://localhost:8080/cayenne-ejbfacade/. There is also a simple command-line client that can be started from [example-folder]/build/bin .
